pkgmetadata.longdescription: # LibSANPython library to manage Storage Area Network devices## Installation### Dependencies * Python>=3.6 * pip>=20.3### Fedora, RHEL-8, RHEL-9`dnf install python3-pip` (optional) create virtualenv `python3 -m pip install virtualenv` `python3 -m venv ~/libsan-venv``~/libsan-venv/bin/python3 -m pip install -U pip wheel` `~/libsan-venv/bin/python3 -m pip install libsan` (use `libsan[ssh]` to install optional ssh capabilities)### From source`git clone; cd python-libsan` \`python3 -m pip install .` \or \`python3 -m pip install .[ssh]`### Installation on alternate architecturesBefore installing libsan on non-x86_64 archs (s390x, ppc64le, aarch64),install `python3-devel` and `gcc` to be able to compile dependencies as needed.### How to uninstall the module`python3 -m pip uninstall libsan`## Usage:Before using the modules copy sample_san_top.confto /etc/san_top.conf (this is the default path to read the config) andedit it according to your SAN environment.
